topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d08c346368725fe4280100#post_53d08c346368725fe4280100
I didn't mean it was getting canceled right now; rather they're debating whether or not to continue it next season.  If they do continue it'll be a online only show with much fewer episodes per season.







Oh oh!  I thought of a interesting question:
Hypothetically let's say biomechatronics reaches fruition, basically cybernetics, and while it helps amputees they offer limited aesthetic augmentations that can not be major.  Basically let's say cybernetics does become a thing, but due to limitations of it being new you couldn't replace your entire body, nor your organs, nor major parts.  What would you get?  Like you could get minor implants so long as they don't interfere with your internal organs, but not to the extent that it poses a risk.  So basically you could get something like if you do a lot of walking replace the knee down or aesthetic changes but not to the extent it's all over.  So if say you want to be a furry or such you couldn't due to limitations of your body no longer being able to properly cool down because the "skin" wouldn't be able to sweat.

What would you get and why?

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d08e7563687261b1310100#post_53d08e7563687261b1310100
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d08dff636872615f1a0100#post_53d08dff636872615f1a0100

A retractable nail, or a sleep inhibator that corrects the "Sleep but no rest" problem I'll most likely develop in the future[/bq]
You could actually theoretically have a implant to make it to where you wouldn't need to sleep.

The reason why you need sleep is that when you are awake protein builds up in your brain and that when you are asleep the tubes relax and expand to extract these proteins expand allowing for the chemical to break it down to flow better.  If say a chemical was developed to break down the proteins that build up while you're a awake better or something was devised to allow better flow you theoretically wouldn't ever need sleep.

topics.body: Shotaro tossed and turned in his bed. He couldn't sleep. He hadn't been able to sleep well in a while. His mind had been occupied by one thought. Phillip. He thought he'd lost his best friend. But he couldn't help feel like their friendship was something more.
